title_en: DCAF-Net: Dual-Channel Attentive Fusion Network for Lower Limb Motion Intention Prediction in Stroke Rehabilitation Exoskeletons
title_zh: DCAF-Net：面向脑卒中康复外骨骼下肢运动意图预测的双通道注意力融合网络
summary_en: Rehabilitation exoskeletons have shown promising results in promoting recovery for stroke patients. Accurately and timely identifying the motion intentions of patients is a critical challenge in enhancing active participation during lower limb exoskeleton-assisted rehabilitation training. This paper proposes a Dual-Channel Attentive Fusion Network (DCAF-Net) that synergistically integrates pre-movement surface electromyography (sEMG) and inertial measurement unit (IMU) data for lower limb intention prediction in stroke patients. First, a dual-channel adaptive channel attention module is designed to extract discriminative features from 48 time-domain and frequency-domain features derived from bilateral gastrocnemius sEMG signals. Second, an IMU encoder combining convolutional neural network (CNN) and attention-based long short-term memory (attention-LSTM) layers is designed to decode temporal-spatial movement patterns. Third, the sEMG and IMU features are fused through concatenation to enable accurate recognition of motion intention. Extensive experiment on 11 participants (8 stroke subjects and 3 healthy subjects) demonstrate the effectiveness of DCAF-Net. It achieved a prediction accuracies of 97.19% for patients and 93.56% for healthy subjects. This study provides a viable solution for implementing intention-driven human-in-the-loop assistance control in clinical rehabilitation robotics.
summary_zh: 康复外骨骼在促进脑卒中患者功能恢复方面已展现出良好前景。在辅助下肢康复训练过程中，准确、及时地识别患者的运动意图是提升其主动参与度的关键挑战。本文提出一种双通道注意力融合网络（DCAF-Net），该网络协同融合运动前表面肌电信号与惯性测量单元数据，用于预测脑卒中患者的下肢运动意图。首先，设计了一个双通道自适应通道注意力模块，用于从双侧腓肠肌表面肌电信号提取的48个时域与频域特征中筛选判别性特征。其次，构建了一个结合卷积神经网络与基于注意力的长短期记忆网络的惯性测量单元编码器，以解码时空运动模式。再次，通过特征拼接方式融合表面肌电与惯性测量单元特征，实现运动意图的精准识别。在11名受试者（8名脑卒中患者与3名健康受试者）上开展的广泛实验验证了DCAF-Net的有效性，其对患者和健康受试者的预测准确率分别达到97.19%和93.56%。本研究为临床康复机器人中实现意图驱动的人机协同辅助控制提供了可行方案。
